text: 1807 was the 21st season of cricket in England since the foundation of Marylebone Cricket Club (MCC). John Willes of Kent first tried to revive the idea of "straight-armed" (i.e., roundarm) bowling, which had originated with Tom Walker in the 1790s. ==Honours== * Most runsNote that scorecards created in the first quarter of the 19th century are not necessarily accurate or complete; therefore any summary of runs, wickets or catches can only represent the known totals and computation of averages is ineffectual. – William Lambert 355 (HS 110) * Most wickets – John Wells 24 ==Events== * John Willes of Kent first tried to revive the idea of "straight-armed" (i.e., roundarm) bowling, which had originated with Tom Walker in the 1790s.Bowen, p.268. * With the Napoleonic War continuing, loss of investment and manpower impacted cricket and only 7 first-class matches have been recorded in 1807: ** 18–19 May: MCC v Middlesex @ Lord's Old GroundHaygarth, p.333. ** 25–26 May: All-England v Hampshire @ Lord's Old Ground ** 2–3 June: MCC v All-England @ Lord's Old GroundHaygarth, p.334. ** 15–16 June: All-England v Hampshire @ Lord's Old GroundHaygarth, p.335. ** 22–24 June: Lord F Beauclerk's XI v T Mellish's XI @ Lord's Old Ground ** 29–30 June: All-England v Surrey @ Lord's Old GroundHaygarth, p.337. ** 13 July: All-England v Surrey @ Lord's Old GroundHaygarth, p.339. ==Debutants== 1807 debutants included: * John Bentley (Middlesex) * Noah Mann junior (MCC) ==References== ==Bibliography== * ==Further reading== * * * * * ==External links== * * Category:1807 in English cricket Category:English cricket seasons from 1787 to 1815
